thread.title: Sand Lizards overcome mistakes, defeat Clinton
thread.title_full: Sand Lizards overcome mistakes, defeat Clinton

author: Travis Simpson (noreply@couriernews.com)
title: Sand Lizards overcome mistakes, defeat Clinton
text: slideshow CLINTON — Dardanelle Sand Lizards head coach Josh Price was happy to escape Clinton with a 35-7 win, even one the coach described as being “sloppier than he would have liked.”“We had some special teams miscues,” he said. “It wasn’t as smooth as it should have been, but it was good enough for a win. We are very proud of our kids to go on the road at Clinton and win. Clinton is a tough place to play.”Dardanelle (5-0, 2-0 4A-4 Conference) went 1-for-3 on PAT kicks and 0-3 on field goals. The Sand Lizards were forced to get those points back late in the game on 2-point conversions.Chris Kershner had three touchdowns in the first half. Caden Brown added another from the 2-yard line. Daniel Craig added a touchdown in the third quarter and Caden Brown the 2-point conversion to squeak in the Mercy Rule.“We were very pleased with our defense,” Price said. “They created turnovers. Our defensive backs made great plays. We did a good job of keeping guys in front of us and giving up big plays. It’s another big win. We will take it.”Dardanelle will host Arkansas Baptist on Friday for homecoming.
